channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: マーティ・バロンの近刊『Collision of Power』からの抜粋：「民主主義は暗闇の中で死ぬ」というスローガン、トランプがベゾスにポストの報道改善を依頼したことなど（Martin Baron/The Atlantic）
item.description:
Martin Baron / The Atlantic:
An excerpt from Marty Baron's upcoming book, Collision of Power: the “Democracy Dies in Darkness” slogan, Trump asking Bezos for better Post coverage, and more  —  And other stories from eight years running The Washington Post  —  I should not have been surprised …

item.title: メモニューヨーク・パブリック・ラジオのラフォンテーン・オリヴァー社長兼CEOは、「広告市場の自由落下」のため、NYPRのスタッフを〜12％削減する計画である（Benjamin Mullin/New York Times）。
item.description:
Benjamin Mullin / New York Times:
Memo: New York Public Radio President and CEO LaFontaine Oliver plans to cut NYPR staff by ~12% due to a “free fall in the advertising market”  —  The chief executive of New York Public Radio, which operates WNYC and the classical music station WQXR, said the organization was facing a “free-fall” in advertising.

item.title: 情報源：WGAとAMPTPの合意により、スタジオは脚本家の仕事についてAIモデルを訓練することができる一方、脚本家はAIツールが使用されても脚本の仕事について報酬を得ることになる（Wall Street Journal）。
item.description:
Wall Street Journal:
Sources: the WGA and AMPTP's deal lets studios train AI models on writers' work while writers would be compensated for work on scripts even if AI tools are used  —  Writers are expected to be guaranteed credit and compensation for work they do on scripts, even if studios partially use AI tools

item.title: Metric Mediaのローカルサイト・ネットワークに関連するLocal Labsは、共和党支持のクライアントから数百件の公文書公開請求に対して報酬を得ており、選挙当局を妨害している（Jen Fifield/Votebeat）
item.description:
Jen Fifield / Votebeat:
Local Labs, tied to Metric Media's network of local websites, is paid by GOP-backed clients for hundreds of public records requests, stymying election officials  —  Local Labs seeks voter data through extensive requests around the U.S. — and blurs the line between political research and journalism.

item.title: CollegeHumorは、同社が2018年に開始した「数十万人半ば」のユーザーを抱える月額6ドルのストリーミングサービスの名称「Dropout」にリブランディング（Todd Spangler/Variety）
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
CollegeHumor rebrands as Dropout, the name of the $6/month streaming service the company launched in 2018 that has users in the “mid-hundreds of thousands”  —  CollegeHumor is dropping its collegiate moniker after nearly 25 years... to become Dropout.

item.title: FCC委員長のジェシカ・ローゼンウォーセルがネット中立性復活計画を発表、「2015年に委員会が採択した成功したルールにほぼ戻す」ことを目指す（Devin Coldewey/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Devin Coldewey / TechCrunch:
FCC Chair Jessica Rosenworcel announces plans to reinstate net neutrality, seeking to “largely return to the successful rules the Commission adopted in 2015”  —  Net neutrality is back on the menu, citizens.  After a long, long battle ending in eventual defeat during Trump's presidency …

item.title: Punchbowl Newsによると、このニュース新興企業の2023年の売上は、2021年の1,000万ドルから2,000万ドル近くになる見込みで、単独記事へのリンクを備えたウェブサイトを刷新する（Sara Fischer/Axios）
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
Punchbowl News says the news startup is on track to nearly $20M in 2023 revenue, up from $10M in 2021, and revamps its website with links to standalone articles  —  Punchbowl News, the D.C.-based congressional news startup, on Tuesday debuted a revamped website with links to stand-alone stories.

item.title: メモニューヨーク・パブリック・ラジオのラフォンテーン・オリヴァー社長兼CEOは、「長期的な財政維持の必要性」を理由に、NYPRのスタッフを〜12％削減する計画（Ben Mullin/@benmullin）
item.description:
Ben Mullin / @benmullin:
Memo: New York Public Radio President and CEO LaFontaine Oliver plans to cut NYPR staff by ~12% due to “the necessity for long-term financial sustainability”  —  New York Public Radio, the parent organization of WNYC, is cutting its staff by about 12%, according to a note to staff from President and CEO LaFontaine Oliver [image]

item.title: 情報源: ゴールデングローブ賞、2024年1月の授賞式に2つの新部門を追加予定。
item.description:
Matt Donnelly / Variety:
Sources: the Golden Globe Awards plans to add two new categories to its January 2024 show: for highest-earning or most-seen films and for stand-up comedy on TV  —  The Golden Globe Awards will introduce two new categories to its upcoming January broadcast, Variety has learned exclusively.

item.title: ロス・インテリジェンスが競合するAIベースのプラットフォームを訓練するためにウェストローのコンテンツをコピーしたとするトムソン・ロイターの訴訟について、米判事が裁判を行うべきとの判決を下した（Blake Brittain/Reuters）
item.description:
Blake Brittain / Reuters:
A US judge rules that the Thomson Reuters lawsuit accusing Ross Intelligence of copying Westlaw content to train a competing AI-based platform must go to trial  —  A jury must decide the outcome of a lawsuit by information services company Thomson Reuters (TRI.TO) accusing Ross Intelligence …

item.title: Netflix、Paramount、WBD、Comcast、Disney、Univisionなどが業界団体「Streaming Innovation Alliance」を結成、Apple、Amazon、Rokuなどは不参加（Sara Fischer/Axios）
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
Netflix, Paramount, WBD, Comcast, Disney, Univision, and others form the Streaming Innovation Alliance trade group; Apple, Amazon, Roku, and others didn't join  —  The world's biggest streaming companies are coming together to launch the industry's first unified coalition, the Streaming Innovation Alliance (SIA).

item.title: グーグルは「2024年後半」にGoogle Podcastsを閉鎖し、ストリーミングリスナーをYouTube Musicに移す計画。
item.description:
Sarah Perez / TechCrunch:
Google plans to shut down Google Podcasts “later in 2024”, moving its streaming listeners to YouTube Music, which will support US podcasts and RSS feeds by 2024  —  Google announced this morning it will be shutting down its Google Podcasts app later in 2024 as part of its broader transition …

item.title: 1977年から2016年までのニューヨーク・タイムズの編集者、文化、スキャンダル、戦略を綴ったアダム・ナガニーの新著『The Times』の紹介（Shawn McCreesh/New York Magazine）
item.description:
Shawn McCreesh / New York Magazine:
A look at Adam Nagourney's new book, The Times, which chronicles the editors, culture, scandals, and strategies at The New York Times from 1977 to 2016  —  In the second chapter of The Kingdom and the Power, the 1969 book about the first 75 years that the New York Times was owned …

item.title: シリウスXMの株式の約83％を保有するリバティ・メディアは、シリウスXMを傘下に置くLSXMとシリウスXMホールディングスの分割・統合を提案（Molly Schuetz/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Molly Schuetz / Bloomberg:
Liberty Media, which holds an ~83% stake in SiriusXM, proposes splitting and combining LSXM, the business that houses SiriusXM, with Sirius XM Holdings  —  - Liberty already owns 83% of SirisuXM, held in tracking stock  — Malone has sprawling interests across media, entertainment

item.title: ノースイースタン大学のメレディス・クラークとThe Pivot Fundの創設者トレイシー・パウエルとのQ&A：BIPOC報道機関への資金提供の研究、ローカルニュースなどについて（Hanaa' Tameez/Nieman Lab）
item.description:
Hanaa' Tameez / Nieman Lab:
Q&A with Northeastern University's Meredith Clark and The Pivot Fund founder Tracie Powell about studying funding to BIPOC news outlets, local news, and more  —  “You say you're giving more dollars to BIPOC newsrooms?  Well, you're actually giving to intermediaries who are filtering down those dollars to BIPOC newsrooms.
